param.name: AntennaTracker:FORMAT_VERSION
param.documentation: This value is incremented when changes are made to the eeprom format

param.humanName: MAVLink system ID of this vehicle
param.name: AntennaTracker:SYSID_THISMAV
param.documentation: Allows setting an individual system id for this vehicle to distinguish it from others on the same network

param.name: AntennaTracker:SYSID_MYGCS
param.documentation: The identifier of the ground station in the MAVLink protocol. Don't change this unless you also modify the ground station to match.

param.name: AntennaTracker:SYSID_TARGET
param.documentation: The identifier of the vehicle being tracked. This should be zero (to auto detect) or be the same as the SYSID_THISMAV parameter of the vehicle being tracked.

param.humanName: Time for yaw to slew through its full range
param.name: AntennaTracker:YAW_SLEW_TIME
param.documentation: This controls how rapidly the tracker will change the servo output for yaw. It is set as the number of seconds to do a full rotation. You can use this parameter to slow the trackers movements, which may help with some types of trackers. A value of zero will allow for unlimited servo movement per update.

param.humanName: Time for pitch to slew through its full range
param.name: AntennaTracker:PITCH_SLEW_TIME
param.documentation: This controls how rapidly the tracker will change the servo output for pitch. It is set as the number of seconds to do a full range of pitch movement. You can use this parameter to slow the trackers movements, which may help with some types of trackers. A value of zero will allow for unlimited servo movement per update.

param.humanName: Minimum time to apply a yaw reversal
param.name: AntennaTracker:MIN_REVERSE_TIME
param.documentation: When the tracker detects it has reached the limit of servo movement in yaw it will reverse and try moving to the other extreme of yaw. This parameter controls the minimum time it should reverse for. It is used to cope with trackers that have a significant lag in movement to ensure they do move all the way around.

param.name: AntennaTracker:START_LATITUDE
param.documentation: Combined with START_LONGITUDE this parameter allows for an initial position of the tracker to be set. This position will be used until the GPS gets lock. It can also be used to run a stationary tracker with no GPS attached.

param.name: AntennaTracker:START_LONGITUDE
param.documentation: Combined with START_LATITUDE this parameter allows for an initial position of the tracker to be set. This position will be used until the GPS gets lock. It can also be used to run a stationary tracker with no GPS attached.

param.humanName: Delay before first servo movement from trim
param.name: AntennaTracker:STARTUP_DELAY
param.documentation: This parameter can be used to force the servos to their trim value for a time on startup. This can help with some servo types

param.humanName: Type of servo system being used for pitch
param.name: AntennaTracker:SERVO_PITCH_TYPE
param.documentation: This allows selection of position servos or on/off servos for pitch

param.humanName: Type of servo system being used for yaw
param.name: AntennaTracker:SERVO_YAW_TYPE
param.documentation: This allows selection of position servos or on/off servos for yaw

param.name: AntennaTracker:ONOFF_YAW_RATE
param.documentation: Rate of change of yaw in degrees/second for on/off servos

param.name: AntennaTracker:ONOFF_PITCH_RATE
param.documentation: Rate of change of pitch in degrees/second for on/off servos

param.name: AntennaTracker:ONOFF_YAW_MINT
param.documentation: Minimum amount of time in seconds to move in yaw

param.name: AntennaTracker:ONOFF_PITCH_MINT
param.documentation: Minimum amount of time in seconds to move in pitch

param.name: AntennaTracker:YAW_TRIM
param.documentation: Amount of extra yaw to add when tracking. This allows for small adjustments for an out of trim compass.

param.name: AntennaTracker:PITCH_TRIM
param.documentation: Amount of extra pitch to add when tracking. This allows for small adjustments for a badly calibrated barometer.

param.name: AntennaTracker:YAW_RANGE
param.documentation: Yaw axis total range of motion in degrees

param.name: AntennaTracker:DISTANCE_MIN
param.documentation: Tracker will track targets at least this distance away

param.name: AntennaTracker:ALT_SOURCE
param.documentation: What provides altitude information for vehicle. Vehicle only assumes tracker has same altitude as vehicle's home

param.name: AntennaTracker:MAV_UPDATE_RATE
param.documentation: The rate at which Mavlink updates position and baro data

param.name: AntennaTracker:PITCH_MIN
param.documentation: The lowest angle the pitch can reach

param.name: AntennaTracker:PITCH_MAX
param.documentation: The highest angle the pitch can reach

param.name: AntennaTracker:LOG_BITMASK
param.documentation: 4 byte bitmap of log types to enable

param.name: AntennaTracker:PITCH2SRV_P
param.documentation: Pitch axis controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired pitch angle and actual pitch angle into a pitch servo pwm change

param.name: AntennaTracker:PITCH2SRV_I
param.documentation: Pitch axis controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired pitch angle vs actual pitch angle

param.humanName: Pitch axis controller I gain maximum
param.name: AntennaTracker:PITCH2SRV_IMAX
param.documentation: Pitch axis controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum pwm change that the I gain will output

param.name: AntennaTracker:PITCH2SRV_D
param.documentation: Pitch axis controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired pitch angle vs actual pitch angle

param.name: AntennaTracker:PITCH2SRV_FF
param.documentation: Pitch axis controller feed forward

param.humanName: Pitch axis controller target frequency in Hz
param.name: AntennaTracker:PITCH2SRV_FLTT
param.documentation: Pitch axis controller target frequency in Hz

param.humanName: Pitch axis controller error frequency in Hz
param.name: AntennaTracker:PITCH2SRV_FLTE
param.documentation: Pitch axis controller error frequency in Hz

param.humanName: Pitch axis controller derivative frequency in Hz
param.name: AntennaTracker:PITCH2SRV_FLTD
param.documentation: Pitch axis controller derivative frequency in Hz

param.name: AntennaTracker:PITCH2SRV_SMAX
param.documentation: Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.

param.humanName: Pitch axis controller PD sum maximum
param.name: AntennaTracker:PITCH2SRV_PDMX
param.documentation: Pitch axis controller PD sum maximum. The maximum/minimum value that the sum of the P and D term can output

param.name: AntennaTracker:PITCH2SRV_D_FF
param.documentation: FF D Gain which produces an output that is proportional to the rate of change of the target

param.name: AntennaTracker:PITCH2SRV_NTF
param.documentation: Pitch Target notch filter index

param.name: AntennaTracker:PITCH2SRV_NEF
param.documentation: Pitch Error notch filter index

param.name: AntennaTracker:YAW2SRV_P
param.documentation: Yaw axis controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired yaw angle (heading) and actual yaw angle into a yaw servo pwm change

param.name: AntennaTracker:YAW2SRV_I
param.documentation: Yaw axis controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired yaw angle (heading) vs actual yaw angle

param.humanName: Yaw axis controller I gain maximum
param.name: AntennaTracker:YAW2SRV_IMAX
param.documentation: Yaw axis controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum pwm change that the I gain will output

param.name: AntennaTracker:YAW2SRV_D
param.documentation: Yaw axis controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired yaw angle (heading) vs actual yaw angle

param.name: AntennaTracker:YAW2SRV_FF
param.documentation: Yaw axis controller feed forward

param.humanName: Yaw axis controller target frequency in Hz
param.name: AntennaTracker:YAW2SRV_FLTT
param.documentation: Yaw axis controller target frequency in Hz

param.humanName: Yaw axis controller error frequency in Hz
param.name: AntennaTracker:YAW2SRV_FLTE
param.documentation: Yaw axis controller error frequency in Hz

param.humanName: Yaw axis controller derivative frequency in Hz
param.name: AntennaTracker:YAW2SRV_FLTD
param.documentation: Yaw axis controller derivative frequency in Hz

param.name: AntennaTracker:YAW2SRV_SMAX
param.documentation: Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.

param.humanName: Yaw axis controller PD sum maximum
param.name: AntennaTracker:YAW2SRV_PDMX
param.documentation: Yaw axis controller PD sum maximum. The maximum/minimum value that the sum of the P and D term can output

param.name: AntennaTracker:YAW2SRV_D_FF
param.documentation: FF D Gain which produces an output that is proportional to the rate of change of the target

param.name: AntennaTracker:YAW2SRV_NTF
param.documentation: Yaw Target notch filter index

param.name: AntennaTracker:YAW2SRV_NEF
param.documentation: Yaw Error notch filter index

param.name: AntennaTracker:CMD_TOTAL
param.documentation: Set to 1 if HOME location has been loaded by the ground station. Do not change this manually.

param.name: AntennaTracker:GCS_PID_MASK
param.documentation: bitmask of PIDs to send MAVLink PID_TUNING messages for

param.humanName: Speed at which to rotate the yaw axis in scan mode
param.name: AntennaTracker:SCAN_SPEED_YAW
param.documentation: This controls how rapidly the tracker will move the servos in SCAN mode

param.humanName: Speed at which to rotate pitch axis in scan mode
param.name: AntennaTracker:SCAN_SPEED_PIT
param.documentation: This controls how rapidly the tracker will move the servos in SCAN mode

param.humanName: Mode tracker will switch into after initialization
param.name: AntennaTracker:INITIAL_MODE
param.documentation: 0:MANUAL, 1:STOP, 2:SCAN, 10:AUTO

param.humanName: PWM that will be output when disarmed or in stop mode
param.name: AntennaTracker:SAFE_DISARM_PWM
param.documentation: 0:zero pwm, 1:trim pwm

param.name: AntennaTracker:AUTO_OPTIONS
param.documentation: 1: Scan for unknown target

param.name: WINCH_RATE_UP
param.documentation: Maximum rate when retracting line

param.name: WINCH_RATE_DN
param.documentation: Maximum rate when releasing line

param.name: WINCH_RC_FUNC
param.documentation: RCn_OPTION number to use to control winch rate

param.name: PLND_ALT_CUTOFF
param.documentation: The altitude (rangefinder distance) below which we stop using the precision landing sensor and continue landing

param.name: DIST_CUTOFF
param.documentation: The distance from target beyond which the target is ignored

param.name: CGA_RATIO
param.documentation: The ratio between the front and back motor outputs during steady-state hover. Positive when the CoG is in front of the motors midpoint (front motors work harder).

param.name: RTUN_ENABLE
param.documentation: Enable quicktune system

param.name: RTUN_AXES
param.documentation: axes to tune

param.humanName: Rover Quicktune Steering Rate FeedForward ratio
param.name: RTUN_STR_FFRATIO
param.documentation: Ratio between measured response and FF gain. Raise this to get a higher FF gain

param.humanName: Rover Quicktune Steering FF to P ratio
param.name: RTUN_STR_P_RATIO
param.documentation: Ratio between steering FF and P gains. Raise this to get a higher P gain, 0 to leave P unchanged

param.humanName: Rover Quicktune Steering FF to I ratio
param.name: RTUN_STR_I_RATIO
param.documentation: Ratio between steering FF and I gains. Raise this to get a higher I gain, 0 to leave I unchanged

param.name: RTUN_SPD_FFRATIO
param.documentation: Ratio between measured response and CRUISE_THROTTLE value. Raise this to get a higher CRUISE_THROTTLE value

param.humanName: Rover Quicktune Speed FF to P ratio
param.name: RTUN_SPD_P_RATIO
param.documentation: Ratio between speed FF and P gain. Raise this to get a higher P gain, 0 to leave P unchanged

param.humanName: Rover Quicktune Speed FF to I ratio
param.name: RTUN_SPD_I_RATIO
param.documentation: Ratio between speed FF and I gain. Raise this to get a higher I gain, 0 to leave I unchanged

param.name: RTUN_AUTO_FILTER
param.documentation: When enabled the PID filter settings are automatically set based on INS_GYRO_FILTER

param.name: RTUN_AUTO_SAVE
param.documentation: Number of seconds after completion of tune to auto-save. This is useful when using a 2 position switch for quicktune

param.name: RTUN_RC_FUNC
param.documentation: RCn_OPTION number to use to control tuning stop/start/save

param.name: ESRC_EXTN_THRESH
param.documentation: ExternalNav may be used if innovations are below this threshold

param.name: ESRC_EXTN_QUAL
param.documentation: ExternalNav may be used if quality is above this threshold

param.name: ESRC_FLOW_THRESH
param.documentation: OpticalFlow may be used if innovations are below this threshold

param.name: ESRC_FLOW_QUAL
param.documentation: OpticalFlow may be used if quality is above this threshold

param.name: ESRC_RNGFND_MAX
param.documentation: OpticalFlow may be used if rangefinder distance is below this threshold

param.name: WEB_ENABLE
param.documentation: enable web server

param.name: WEB_BIND_PORT
param.documentation: web server TCP port

param.name: WEB_DEBUG
param.documentation: web server debugging

param.name: WEB_BLOCK_SIZE
param.documentation: web server block size for download

param.name: WEB_TIMEOUT
param.documentation: timeout for inactive connections

param.humanName: web server minimum file size for sendfile
param.name: WEB_SENDFILE_MIN
param.documentation: sendfile is an offloading mechanism for faster file download. If this is non-zero and the file is larger than this size then sendfile will be used for file download

param.name: QUIK_ENABLE
param.documentation: Enable quicktune system

param.name: QUIK_AXES
param.documentation: axes to tune

param.name: QUIK_DOUBLE_TIME
param.documentation: Time to double a tuning parameter. Raise this for a slower tune.

param.name: QUIK_GAIN_MARGIN
param.documentation: Reduction in gain after oscillation detected. Raise this number to get a more conservative tune

param.name: QUIK_OSC_SMAX
param.documentation: Threshold for oscillation detection. A lower value will lead to a more conservative tune.

param.name: QUIK_YAW_P_MAX
param.documentation: Maximum value for yaw P gain

param.name: QUIK_YAW_D_MAX
param.documentation: Maximum value for yaw D gain

param.name: QUIK_RP_PI_RATIO
param.documentation: Ratio between P and I gains for roll and pitch. Raise this to get a lower I gain

param.name: QUIK_Y_PI_RATIO
param.documentation: Ratio between P and I gains for yaw. Raise this to get a lower I gain

param.name: QUIK_AUTO_FILTER
param.documentation: When enabled the PID filter settings are automatically set based on INS_GYRO_FILTER

param.name: QUIK_AUTO_SAVE
param.documentation: Number of seconds after completion of tune to auto-save. This is useful when using a 2 position switch for quicktune

param.name: QUIK_RC_FUNC
param.documentation: RCn_OPTION number to use to control tuning stop/start/save

param.name: QUIK_MAX_REDUCE
param.documentation: This controls how much quicktune is allowed to lower gains from the original gains. If the vehicle already has a reasonable tune and is not oscillating then you can set this to zero to prevent gain reductions. The default of 20% is reasonable for most vehicles. Using a maximum gain reduction lowers the chance of an angle P oscillation happening if quicktune gets a false positive oscillation at a low gain, which can result in very low rate gains and a dangerous angle P oscillation.

param.name: QUIK_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Additional options. When the Two Position Switch option is enabled then a high switch position will start the tune, low will disable the tune. you should also set a QUIK_AUTO_SAVE time so that you will be able to save the tune.

param.name: PREV_ENABLE
param.documentation: Enable parameter reversion system

param.name: PREV_RC_FUNC
param.documentation: RCn_OPTION number to used to trigger parameter reversion

param.name: RCK_FORCEHL
param.documentation: Automatically enables High Latency mode if not already enabled

param.name: RCK_PERIOD
param.documentation: When in High Latency mode, send Rockblock updates every N seconds

param.name: RCK_DEBUG
param.documentation: Sends Rockblock debug text to GCS via statustexts

param.name: RCK_ENABLE
param.documentation: Enables the Rockblock sending and recieving

param.name: POI_DIST_MAX
param.documentation: POI's max distance (in meters) from the vehicle

param.name: TERR_BRK_ENABLE
param.documentation: terrain brake enable

param.name: TERR_BRK_ALT
param.documentation: terrain brake altitude. The altitude above the ground below which BRAKE mode will be engaged if in LOITER mode.

param.name: TERR_BRK_HDIST
param.documentation: terrain brake home distance. The distance from home where the auto BRAKE will be enabled. When within this distance of home the script will not activate

param.name: TERR_BRK_SPD
param.documentation: terrain brake speed threshold. Don't trigger BRAKE if both horizontal speed and descent rate are below this threshold. By setting this to a small value this can be used to allow the user to climb up to a safe altitude in LOITER mode. A value of 0.5 is recommended if you want to use LOITER to recover from an emergency terrain BRAKE mode change.

param.name: DR_ENABLE
param.documentation: Deadreckoning Enable

param.name: DR_ENABLE_DIST
param.documentation: Distance from home (in meters) beyond which the dead reckoning will be enabled

param.humanName: Deadreckoning GPS speed accuracy maximum threshold
param.name: DR_GPS_SACC_MAX
param.documentation: GPS speed accuracy maximum, above which deadreckoning home will begin (default is 0.8). Lower values trigger with good GPS quality, higher values will allow poorer GPS before triggering. Set to 0 to disable use of GPS speed accuracy

param.humanName: Deadreckoning GPS satellite count min threshold
param.name: DR_GPS_SAT_MIN
param.documentation: GPS satellite count threshold below which deadreckoning home will begin (default is 6). Higher values trigger with good GPS quality, Lower values trigger with worse GPS quality. Set to 0 to disable use of GPS satellite count

param.name: DR_GPS_TRIGG_SEC
param.documentation: GPS checks must fail for this many seconds before dead reckoning will be triggered

param.name: DR_FLY_ANGLE
param.documentation: lean angle (in degrees) during deadreckoning

param.name: DR_FLY_ALT_MIN
param.documentation: Copter will fly at at least this altitude (in meters) above home during deadreckoning

param.name: DR_FLY_TIMEOUT
param.documentation: Copter will attempt to switch to NEXT_MODE after this many seconds of deadreckoning. If it cannot switch modes it will continue in Guided_NoGPS. Set to 0 to disable timeout

param.name: DR_NEXT_MODE
param.documentation: Copter switch to this mode after GPS recovers or DR_FLY_TIMEOUT has elapsed. Default is 6/RTL. Set to -1 to return to mode used before deadreckoning was triggered

param.name: BATT_SOC_COUNT
param.documentation: Number of battery SOC estimators

param.name: BATT_SOC1_IDX
param.documentation: Battery estimator index

param.name: BATT_SOC1_NCELL
param.documentation: Battery estimator cell count

param.name: BATT_SOC1_C1
param.documentation: Battery estimator coefficient1

param.name: BATT_SOC1_C2
param.documentation: Battery estimator coefficient2

param.name: BATT_SOC1_C3
param.documentation: Battery estimator coefficient3

param.name: BATT_SOC2_IDX
param.documentation: Battery estimator index

param.name: BATT_SOC2_NCELL
param.documentation: Battery estimator cell count

param.name: BATT_SOC2_C1
param.documentation: Battery estimator coefficient1

param.name: BATT_SOC2_C2
param.documentation: Battery estimator coefficient2

param.name: BATT_SOC2_C3
param.documentation: Battery estimator coefficient3

param.name: BATT_SOC3_IDX
param.documentation: Battery estimator index

param.name: BATT_SOC3_NCELL
param.documentation: Battery estimator cell count

param.name: BATT_SOC3_C1
param.documentation: Battery estimator coefficient1

param.name: BATT_SOC3_C2
param.documentation: Battery estimator coefficient2

param.name: BATT_SOC3_C3
param.documentation: Battery estimator coefficient3

param.name: BATT_SOC4_IDX
param.documentation: Battery estimator index

param.name: BATT_SOC4_NCELL
param.documentation: Battery estimator cell count

param.name: BATT_SOC4_C1
param.documentation: Battery estimator coefficient1

param.name: BATT_SOC4_C2
param.documentation: Battery estimator coefficient2

param.name: BATT_SOC4_C3
param.documentation: Battery estimator coefficient3

param.name: SHIP_ENABLE
param.documentation: Enable ship landing system

param.name: SHIP_LAND_ANGLE
param.documentation: Angle from the stern of the ship for landing approach. Use this to ensure that on a go-around that ship superstructure and cables are avoided. A value of zero means to approach from the rear of the ship. A value of 90 means the landing will approach from the port (left) side of the ship. A value of -90 will mean approaching from the starboard (right) side of the ship. A value of 180 will approach from the bow of the ship. This parameter is combined with the sign of the RTL_RADIUS parameter to determine the holdoff pattern. If RTL_RADIUS is positive then a clockwise loiter is performed, if RTL_RADIUS is negative then a counter-clockwise loiter is used.

param.name: SHIP_AUTO_OFS
param.documentation: Settings this parameter to one triggers an automatic follow offset calculation based on current position of the vehicle and the landing target. NOTE: This parameter will auto-reset to zero once the offset has been calculated.

param.name: AEROM_ANG_ACCEL
param.documentation: Maximum angular acceleration in maneuvers

param.name: AEROM_ANG_TC
param.documentation: This is the time over which we filter the desired roll to smooth it

param.name: AEROM_THR_PIT_FF
param.documentation: This controls how much extra throttle to add based on pitch ange. The value is for 90 degrees and is applied in proportion to pitch

param.name: AEROM_SPD_P
param.documentation: This controls how rapidly the throttle is raised to compensate for a speed error

param.name: AEROM_SPD_I
param.documentation: This controls how rapidly the throttle is raised to compensate for a speed error

param.name: AEROM_ROL_COR_TC
param.documentation: This is the time constant for correcting roll errors. A smaller value leads to faster roll corrections

param.humanName: Time constant for correction of our distance along the path
param.name: AEROM_TIME_COR_P
param.documentation: This is the time constant for correcting path position errors

param.humanName: P gain for path error corrections
param.name: AEROM_ERR_COR_P
param.documentation: This controls how rapidly we correct back onto the desired path

param.humanName: D gain for path error corrections
param.name: AEROM_ERR_COR_D
param.documentation: This controls how rapidly we correct back onto the desired path

param.humanName: The roll rate to use when entering a roll maneuver
param.name: AEROM_ENTRY_RATE
param.documentation: This controls how rapidly we roll into a new orientation

param.name: AEROM_THR_LKAHD
param.documentation: This controls how far ahead we look in time along the path for the target throttle

param.name: AEROM_DEBUG
param.documentation: This controls the printing of extra debug information on paths

param.name: AEROM_THR_MIN
param.documentation: Lowest throttle used during maneuvers

param.name: AEROM_THR_BOOST
param.documentation: This is the extra throttle added in schedule elements marked as needing a throttle boost

param.name: AEROM_YAW_ACCEL
param.documentation: This is maximum yaw acceleration to use

param.name: AEROM_LKAHD
param.documentation: This is how much time to look ahead in the path for calculating path rates

param.name: AEROM_PATH_SCALE
param.documentation: Scale factor for Path/Box size. 0.5 would half the distances in maneuvers. Radii are unaffected.

param.name: AEROM_BOX_WIDTH
param.documentation: Length of aerobatic "box"

param.name: AEROM_STALL_THR
param.documentation: Amount of throttle to reduce to for a stall turn

param.name: AEROM_STALL_PIT
param.documentation: Pitch threashold for moving to final stage of stall turn

param.name: AEROM_KE_RUDD
param.documentation: Percent of rudder normally uses to sustain knife-edge at trick speed

param.name: AEROM_KE_RUDD_LK
param.documentation: Time to look ahead in the path to calculate rudder correction for bank angle

param.name: AEROM_ALT_ABORT
param.documentation: Maximum allowable loss in altitude during a trick or sequence from its starting altitude.

param.name: AEROM_TS_P
param.documentation: This controls how rapidly two aircraft are brought back into time sync

param.name: AEROM_TS_I
param.documentation: This controls how rapidly two aircraft are brought back into time sync

param.name: AEROM_TS_SPDMAX
param.documentation: This sets the maximum speed adjustment for time sync between aircraft

param.humanName: Timesync rate of send of NAMED_VALUE_FLOAT data
param.name: AEROM_TS_RATE
param.documentation: This sets the rate we send data for time sync between aircraft

param.name: AEROM_MIS_ANGLE
param.documentation: When set to a non-zero value, this is the assumed direction of the mission. Otherwise the waypoint angle is used

param.name: AEROM_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Options to control aerobatic behavior

param.name: TRIK_ENABLE
param.documentation: Enables Tricks on Switch. TRIK params hidden until enabled

param.name: TRIK_SEL_FN
param.documentation: Setting an RC channel's _OPTION to this value will use it for trick selection

param.name: TRIK_ACT_FN
param.documentation: Setting an RC channel's _OPTION to this value will use it for trick action (abort,announce,execute)

param.name: TRIK_COUNT
param.documentation: Number of tricks which can be selected over the range of the trik selection RC channel

param.name: EFI_H6K_ENABLE
param.documentation: Enable Halo6000 EFI driver

param.name: EFI_H6K_CANDRV
param.documentation: Halo6000 CAN driver. Use 1 for first CAN scripting driver, 2 for 2nd driver

param.name: EFI_H6K_START_FN
param.documentation: The RC auxilliary function number for start/stop of the generator. Zero to disable start function

param.name: EFI_H6K_TELEM_RT
param.documentation: The rate that additional generator telemetry is sent

param.name: EFI_H6K_FUELTOT
param.documentation: The capacity of the tank in litres

param.name: EFI_H6K_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Halo6000 options

param.name: VIEP_DEBUG
param.documentation: ViewPro debug

param.name: VIEP_CAM_SWLOW
param.documentation: Camera selection when switch is in low position

param.name: VIEP_CAM_SWMID
param.documentation: Camera selection when switch is in middle position

param.name: VIEP_CAM_SWHIGH
param.documentation: Camera selection when switch is in high position

param.name: VIEP_ZOOM_SPEED
param.documentation: ViewPro Zoom Speed. Higher numbers result in faster zooming

param.name: VIEP_ZOOM_MAX
param.documentation: ViewPro Zoom Times Max

param.name: EFI_2K_ENABLE
param.documentation: Enable NMEA 2000 EFI driver

param.name: EFI_2K_CANDRV
param.documentation: NMEA 2000 CAN driver. Use 1 for first CAN scripting driver, 2 for 2nd driver

param.name: EFI_2K_OPTIONS
param.documentation: NMEA 2000 driver options

param.name: DJIR_DEBUG
param.documentation: Enable DJIRS2 debug

param.name: DJIR_UPSIDEDOWN
param.documentation: DJIRS2 upside down

param.name: EFI_SP_ENABLE
param.documentation: Enable SkyPower EFI support

param.name: EFI_SP_CANDRV
param.documentation: Set SkyPower EFI CAN driver

param.name: EFI_SP_UPDATE_HZ
param.documentation: SkyPower EFI update rate

param.name: EFI_SP_THR_FN
param.documentation: SkyPower EFI throttle function. This sets which SERVOn_FUNCTION to use for the target throttle. This should be 70 for fixed wing aircraft and 31 for helicopter rotor speed control

param.name: EFI_SP_THR_RATE
param.documentation: SkyPower EFI throttle rate. This sets rate at which throttle updates are sent to the engine

param.name: EFI_SP_START_FN
param.documentation: SkyPower EFI start function. This is the RCn_OPTION value to use to find the R/C channel used for controlling engine start

param.name: EFI_SP_GEN_FN
param.documentation: SkyPower EFI generator control function. This is the RCn_OPTION value to use to find the R/C channel used for controlling generator start/stop

param.name: EFI_SP_MIN_RPM
param.documentation: SkyPower EFI minimum RPM. This is the RPM below which the engine is considered to be stopped

param.name: EFI_SP_TLM_RT
param.documentation: SkyPower EFI telemetry rate. This is the rate at which extra telemetry values are sent to the GCS

param.name: EFI_SP_LOG_RT
param.documentation: SkyPower EFI log rate. This is the rate at which extra logging of the SkyPower EFI is performed

param.name: EFI_SP_ST_DISARM
param.documentation: SkyPower EFI allow start disarmed. This controls if starting the engine while disarmed is allowed

param.name: EFI_SP_MODEL
param.documentation: SkyPower EFI ECU model

param.name: EFI_SP_GEN_CTRL
param.documentation: SkyPower EFI enable generator control

param.name: EFI_SP_RST_TIME
param.documentation: SkyPower EFI restart time. If engine should be running and it has stopped for this amount of time then auto-restart. To disable this feature set this value to zero.

param.name: EFI_DLA_ENABLE
param.documentation: Enable EFI DLA driver

param.name: EFI_DLA_LPS
param.documentation: EFI DLA litres of fuel per second of injection time

param.name: BATT_ANX_ENABLE
param.documentation: Enable ANX battery support

param.name: BATT_ANX_CANDRV
param.documentation: Set ANX CAN driver

param.name: BATT_ANX_INDEX
param.documentation: ANX CAN battery index

param.name: BATT_ANX_OPTIONS
param.documentation: ANX CAN battery options

param.name: EFI_SVF_ENABLE
param.documentation: Enable SVFFI generator support

param.name: EFI_SVF_ARMCHECK
param.documentation: Check for Generator ARM state before arming

param.name: EFI_INF_ENABLE
param.documentation: Enable EFI INF-Inject driver

param.name: EFI_INF_OPTIONS
param.documentation: EFI INF driver options

param.name: EFI_INF_THR_HZ
param.documentation: EFI INF throttle output rate

param.name: EFI_INF_IGN_AUX
param.documentation: EFI INF throttle ignition aux function

param.name: ESC_HW_ENABLE
param.documentation: Enable Hobbywing ESC telemetry

param.name: ESC_HW_POLES
param.documentation: Number of motor poles for eRPM scaling

param.name: ESC_HW_OFS
param.documentation: Motor number offset of first ESC

param.humanName: TOFSENSE-M to be used as Proximity sensor
param.name: TOFSENSE_PRX
param.documentation: Set 0 if sensor is to be used as a 1-D rangefinder (minimum of all distances will be sent, typically used for height detection). Set 1 if it should be used as a 3-D proximity device (Eg. Obstacle Avoidance)

param.name: TOFSENSE_NO
param.documentation: Number of TOFSENSE-M CAN sensors connected

param.name: TOFSENSE_MODE
param.documentation: TOFSENSE-M mode to be used. 0 for 8x8 mode. 1 for 4x4 mode

param.name: TOFSENSE_INST1
param.documentation: First TOFSENSE-M sensors backend Instance. Setting this to 1 will pick the first backend from PRX_ or RNG_ Parameters (Depending on TOFSENSE_PRX)

param.name: TOFSENSE_ID1
param.documentation: First TOFSENSE-M sensor ID. Leave this at 0 to accept all IDs and if only one sensor is present. You can change ID of sensor from NAssistant Software

param.name: TOFSENSE_INST2
param.documentation: Second TOFSENSE-M sensors backend Instance. Setting this to 2 will pick the second backend from PRX_ or RNG_ Parameters (Depending on TOFSENSE_PRX)

param.name: TOFSENSE_ID2
param.documentation: Second TOFSENSE-M sensor ID. This cannot be 0. You can change ID of sensor from NAssistant Software

param.name: TOFSENSE_INST3
param.documentation: Third TOFSENSE-M sensors backend Instance. Setting this to 3 will pick the second backend from PRX_ or RNG_ Parameters (Depending on TOFSENSE_PRX)

param.name: TOFSENSE_ID3
param.documentation: Third TOFSENSE-M sensor ID. This cannot be 0. You can change ID of sensor from NAssistant Software

param.humanName: TOFSENSE-M to be used as Proximity sensor
param.name: TOFSENSE_S1_PRX
param.documentation: Set 0 if sensor is to be used as a 1-D rangefinder (minimum of all distances will be sent, typically used for height detection). Set 1 if it should be used as a 3-D proximity device (Eg. Obstacle Avoidance)

param.name: TOFSENSE_S1_SP
param.documentation: UART instance sensor is connected to. Set 1 if sensor is connected to the port with fist SERIALx_PROTOCOL = 28.

param.name: TOFSENSE_S1_BR
param.documentation: Serial Port baud rate. Sensor baud rate can be changed from Nassistant software

param.name: AHRS_GPS_GAIN
param.documentation: This controls how much to use the GPS to correct the attitude. This should never be set to zero for a plane as it would result in the plane losing control in turns. For a plane please use the default value of 1.0.

param.humanName: AHRS use GPS for DCM navigation and position-down
param.name: AHRS_GPS_USE
param.documentation: This controls whether to use dead-reckoning or GPS based navigation. If set to 0 then the GPS won't be used for navigation, and only dead reckoning will be used. A value of zero should never be used for normal flight. Currently this affects only the DCM-based AHRS: the EKF uses GPS according to its own parameters. A value of 2 means to use GPS for height as well as position - both in DCM estimation and when determining altitude-above-home.

values.value: Use GPS for DCM position and height

param.name: AHRS_YAW_P
param.documentation: This controls the weight the compass or GPS has on the heading. A higher value means the heading will track the yaw source (GPS or compass) more rapidly.

param.name: AHRS_RP_P
param.documentation: This controls how fast the accelerometers correct the attitude

param.name: AHRS_WIND_MAX
param.documentation: This sets the maximum allowable difference between ground speed and airspeed. A value of zero means to use the airspeed as is. This allows the plane to cope with a failing airspeed sensor by clipping it to groundspeed plus/minus this limit. See ARSPD_OPTIONS and ARSPD_WIND_MAX to disable airspeed sensors.

param.name: AHRS_TRIM_X
param.documentation: Compensates for the roll angle difference between the control board and the frame. Positive values make the vehicle roll right.

param.name: AHRS_TRIM_Y
param.documentation: Compensates for the pitch angle difference between the control board and the frame. Positive values make the vehicle pitch up/back.

param.name: AHRS_TRIM_Z
param.documentation: Not Used

param.name: AHRS_ORIENTATION
param.documentation: Overall board orientation relative to the standard orientation for the board type. This rotates the IMU and compass readings to allow the board to be oriented in your vehicle at any 90 or 45 degree angle. The label for each option is specified in the order of rotations for that orientation. This option takes affect on next boot. After changing you will need to re-level your vehicle. Firmware versions 4.2 and prior can use a CUSTOM (100) rotation to set the AHRS_CUSTOM_ROLL/PIT/YAW angles for AHRS orientation. Later versions provide two general custom rotations which can be used, Custom 1 and Custom 2, with CUST_ROT1_ROLL/PIT/YAW or CUST_ROT2_ROLL/PIT/YAW angles.

param.humanName: AHRS Velocity Complementary Filter Beta Coefficient
param.name: AHRS_COMP_BETA
param.documentation: This controls the time constant for the cross-over frequency used to fuse AHRS (airspeed and heading) and GPS data to estimate ground velocity. Time constant is 0.1/beta. A larger time constant will use GPS data less and a small time constant will use air data less.

param.name: AHRS_GPS_MINSATS
param.documentation: Minimum number of satellites visible to use GPS for velocity based corrections attitude correction. This defaults to 6, which is about the point at which the velocity numbers from a GPS become too unreliable for accurate correction of the accelerometers.

param.humanName: Use NavEKF Kalman filter for attitude and position estimation
param.name: AHRS_EKF_TYPE
param.documentation: This controls which NavEKF Kalman filter version is used for attitude and position estimation

param.name: AHRS_CUSTOM_ROLL
param.documentation: Autopilot mounting position roll offset. Positive values = roll right, negative values = roll left. This parameter is only used when AHRS_ORIENTATION is set to CUSTOM.

param.name: AHRS_CUSTOM_PIT
param.documentation: Autopilot mounting position pitch offset. Positive values = pitch up, negative values = pitch down. This parameter is only used when AHRS_ORIENTATION is set to CUSTOM.

param.name: AHRS_CUSTOM_YAW
param.documentation: Autopilot mounting position yaw offset. Positive values = yaw right, negative values = yaw left. This parameter is only used when AHRS_ORIENTATION is set to CUSTOM.

param.name: AHRS_OPTIONS
param.documentation: This controls optional AHRS behaviour. Setting DisableDCMFallbackFW will change the AHRS behaviour for fixed wing aircraft in fly-forward flight to not fall back to DCM when the EKF stops navigating. Setting DisableDCMFallbackVTOL will change the AHRS behaviour for fixed wing aircraft in non fly-forward (VTOL) flight to not fall back to DCM when the EKF stops navigating.

param.name: AIS_TYPE
param.documentation: AIS receiver type

param.name: AIS_LIST_MAX
param.documentation: AIS list size of nearest vessels. Longer lists take longer to refresh with lower SRx_ADSB values.

param.name: AIS_TIME_OUT
param.documentation: if no updates are received in this time a vessel will be removed from the list

param.name: AIS_LOGGING
param.documentation: Bitmask of AIS logging options
param.field: 0:Log all AIVDM messages,1:Log only unsupported AIVDM messages,2:Log decoded messages

param.name: ARSPD_ENABLE
param.documentation: Enable airspeed sensor support

param.name: ARSPD_TUBE_ORDER
param.documentation: This parameter allows you to control whether the order in which the tubes are attached to your pitot tube matters. If you set this to 0 then the first (often the top) connector on the sensor needs to be the stagnation pressure (the pressure at the tip of the pitot tube). If set to 1 then the second (often the bottom) connector needs to be the stagnation pressure. If set to 2 (the default) then the airspeed driver will accept either order. The reason you may wish to specify the order is it will allow your airspeed sensor to detect if the aircraft is receiving excessive pressure on the static port compared to the stagnation port such as during a stall, which would otherwise be seen as a positive airspeed.

param.name: ARSPD_PRIMARY
param.documentation: This selects which airspeed sensor will be the primary if multiple sensors are found

param.name: ARSPD_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Bitmask of options to use with airspeed. 0:Disable use based on airspeed/groundspeed mismatch (see ARSPD_WIND_MAX), 1:Automatically reenable use based on airspeed/groundspeed mismatch recovery (see ARSPD_WIND_MAX) 2:Disable voltage correction, 3:Check that the airspeed is statistically consistent with the navigation EKF vehicle and wind velocity estimates using EKF3 (requires AHRS_EKF_TYPE = 3), 4:Report cal offset to GCS

param.humanName: Maximum airspeed and ground speed difference
param.name: ARSPD_WIND_MAX
param.documentation: If the difference between airspeed and ground speed is greater than this value the sensor will be marked unhealthy. Using ARSPD_OPTION this health value can be used to disable the sensor.

param.humanName: Airspeed and GPS speed difference that gives a warning
param.name: ARSPD_WIND_WARN
param.documentation: If the difference between airspeed and GPS speed is greater than this value the sensor will issue a warning. If 0 ARSPD_WIND_MAX is used.

param.name: ARSPD_WIND_GATE
param.documentation: Number of standard deviations applied to the re-enable EKF consistency check that is used when ARSPD_OPTIONS bit position 3 is set. Larger values will make the re-enabling of the airspeed sensor faster, but increase the likelihood of re-enabling a degraded sensor. The value can be tuned by using the ARSP.TR log message by setting ARSPD_WIND_GATE to a value that is higher than the value for ARSP.TR observed with a healthy airspeed sensor. Occasional transients in ARSP.TR above the value set by ARSPD_WIND_GATE can be tolerated provided they are less than 5 seconds in duration and less than 10% duty cycle.

param.name: ARSPD_OFF_PCNT
param.documentation: The maximum percentage speed change in airspeed reports that is allowed due to offset changes between calibrations before a warning is issued. This potential speed error is in percent of ASPD_FBW_MIN. 0 disables. Helps warn of calibrations without pitot being covered.

param.name: ARSPD2_TYPE
param.documentation: Type of airspeed sensor

param.name: ARSPD2_USE
param.documentation: Enables airspeed use for automatic throttle modes and replaces control from THR_TRIM. Continues to display and log airspeed if set to 0. Uses airspeed for control if set to 1. Only uses airspeed when throttle = 0 if set to 2 (useful for gliders with airspeed sensors behind propellers).

param.name: ARSPD2_OFFSET
param.documentation: Airspeed calibration offset

param.name: ARSPD2_RATIO
param.documentation: Calibrates pitot tube pressure to velocity. Increasing this value will indicate a higher airspeed at any given dynamic pressure.

param.name: ARSPD2_PIN
param.documentation: The pin number that the airspeed sensor is connected to for analog sensors. Values for some autopilots are given as examples. Search wiki for "Analog pins".

param.name: ARSPD2_AUTOCAL
param.documentation: Enables automatic adjustment of airspeed ratio during a calibration flight based on estimation of ground speed and true airspeed. New ratio saved every 2 minutes if change is > 5%. Should not be left enabled.

param.name: ARSPD2_TUBE_ORDR
param.documentation: This parameter allows you to control whether the order in which the tubes are attached to your pitot tube matters. If you set this to 0 then the first (often the top) connector on the sensor needs to be the stagnation pressure (the pressure at the tip of the pitot tube). If set to 1 then the second (often the bottom) connector needs to be the stagnation pressure. If set to 2 (the default) then the airspeed driver will accept either order. The reason you may wish to specify the order is it will allow your airspeed sensor to detect if the aircraft is receiving excessive pressure on the static port compared to the stagnation port such as during a stall, which would otherwise be seen as a positive airspeed.

param.humanName: Skip airspeed offset calibration on startup
param.name: ARSPD2_SKIP_CAL
param.documentation: This parameter allows you to skip airspeed offset calibration on startup, instead using the offset from the last calibration. This may be desirable if the offset variance between flights for your sensor is low and you want to avoid having to cover the pitot tube on each boot.

param.humanName: The PSI range of the device
param.name: ARSPD2_PSI_RANGE
param.documentation: This parameter allows you to set the PSI (pounds per square inch) range for your sensor. You should not change this unless you examine the datasheet for your device

param.name: ARSPD2_BUS
param.documentation: Bus number of the I2C bus where the airspeed sensor is connected. May not correspond to board's I2C bus number labels. Retry another bus and reboot if airspeed sensor fails to initialize.

param.name: ARSPD2_DEVID
param.documentation: Airspeed sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

param.name: ARSPD_TYPE
param.documentation: Type of airspeed sensor

param.name: ARSPD_USE
param.documentation: Enables airspeed use for automatic throttle modes and replaces control from THR_TRIM. Continues to display and log airspeed if set to 0. Uses airspeed for control if set to 1. Only uses airspeed when throttle = 0 if set to 2 (useful for gliders with airspeed sensors behind propellers).

param.name: ARSPD_OFFSET
param.documentation: Airspeed calibration offset

param.name: ARSPD_RATIO
param.documentation: Calibrates pitot tube pressure to velocity. Increasing this value will indicate a higher airspeed at any given dynamic pressure.

param.name: ARSPD_PIN
param.documentation: The pin number that the airspeed sensor is connected to for analog sensors. Values for some autopilots are given as examples. Search wiki for "Analog pins".

param.name: ARSPD_AUTOCAL
param.documentation: Enables automatic adjustment of airspeed ratio during a calibration flight based on estimation of ground speed and true airspeed. New ratio saved every 2 minutes if change is > 5%. Should not be left enabled.

param.name: ARSPD_TUBE_ORDR
param.documentation: This parameter allows you to control whether the order in which the tubes are attached to your pitot tube matters. If you set this to 0 then the first (often the top) connector on the sensor needs to be the stagnation pressure (the pressure at the tip of the pitot tube). If set to 1 then the second (often the bottom) connector needs to be the stagnation pressure. If set to 2 (the default) then the airspeed driver will accept either order. The reason you may wish to specify the order is it will allow your airspeed sensor to detect if the aircraft is receiving excessive pressure on the static port compared to the stagnation port such as during a stall, which would otherwise be seen as a positive airspeed.

param.humanName: Skip airspeed offset calibration on startup
param.name: ARSPD_SKIP_CAL
param.documentation: This parameter allows you to skip airspeed offset calibration on startup, instead using the offset from the last calibration. This may be desirable if the offset variance between flights for your sensor is low and you want to avoid having to cover the pitot tube on each boot.

param.humanName: The PSI range of the device
param.name: ARSPD_PSI_RANGE
param.documentation: This parameter allows you to set the PSI (pounds per square inch) range for your sensor. You should not change this unless you examine the datasheet for your device

param.name: ARSPD_BUS
param.documentation: Bus number of the I2C bus where the airspeed sensor is connected. May not correspond to board's I2C bus number labels. Retry another bus and reboot if airspeed sensor fails to initialize.

param.name: ARSPD_DEVID
param.documentation: Airspeed sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

param.name: BARO1_GND_PRESS
param.documentation: calibrated ground pressure in Pascals

param.name: BARO_GND_TEMP
param.documentation: User provided ambient ground temperature in degrees Celsius. This is used to improve the calculation of the altitude the vehicle is at. This parameter is not persistent and will be reset to 0 every time the vehicle is rebooted. A value of 0 means use the internal measurement ambient temperature.

param.name: BARO_ALT_OFFSET
param.documentation: altitude offset in meters added to barometric altitude. This is used to allow for automatic adjustment of the base barometric altitude by a ground station equipped with a barometer. The value is added to the barometric altitude read by the aircraft. It is automatically reset to 0 when the barometer is calibrated on each reboot or when a preflight calibration is performed.

param.name: BARO_PRIMARY
param.documentation: This selects which barometer will be the primary if multiple barometers are found

param.name: BARO_EXT_BUS
param.documentation: This selects the bus number for looking for an I2C barometer. When set to -1 it will probe all external i2c buses based on the BARO_PROBE_EXT parameter.

param.name: BARO2_GND_PRESS
param.documentation: calibrated ground pressure in Pascals

param.name: BARO3_GND_PRESS
param.documentation: calibrated ground pressure in Pascals

param.humanName: Range in which sample is accepted
param.name: BARO_FLTR_RNG
param.documentation: This sets the range around the average value that new samples must be within to be accepted. This can help reduce the impact of noise on sensors that are on long I2C cables. The value is a percentage from the average value. A value of zero disables this filter.

param.name: BARO_PROBE_EXT
param.documentation: This sets which types of external i2c barometer to look for. It is a bitmask of barometer types. The I2C buses to probe is based on BARO_EXT_BUS. If BARO_EXT_BUS is -1 then it will probe all external buses, otherwise it will probe just the bus number given in BARO_EXT_BUS.

param.name: BARO1_DEVID
param.documentation: Barometer sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

param.name: BARO2_DEVID
param.documentation: Barometer2 sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

param.name: BARO3_DEVID
param.documentation: Barometer3 sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

param.name: BARO_FIELD_ELV
param.documentation: User provided field elevation in meters. This is used to improve the calculation of the altitude the vehicle is at. This parameter is not persistent and will be reset to 0 every time the vehicle is rebooted. Changes to this parameter will only be used when disarmed. A value of 0 means the EKF origin height is used for takeoff height above sea level.

param.name: BARO_ALTERR_MAX
param.documentation: This is the maximum acceptable altitude discrepancy between GPS altitude and barometric presssure altitude calculated against a standard atmosphere for arming checks to pass. If you are getting an arming error due to this parameter then you may have a faulty or substituted barometer. A common issue is vendors replacing a MS5611 in a "Pixhawk" with a MS5607. If you have that issue then please see BARO_OPTIONS parameter to force the MS5611 to be treated as a MS5607. This check is disabled if the value is zero.

param.name: BARO_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Barometer options

param.name: BARO1_WCF_ENABLE
param.documentation: This enables the use of wind coefficients for barometer compensation

param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in positive X direction (forward)
param.name: BARO1_WCF_FWD
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the X body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during forwards flight, then this will be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in negative X direction (backwards)
param.name: BARO1_WCF_BCK
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a negative wind relative velocity along the X body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during backwards flight, then this will be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in positive Y direction (right)
param.name: BARO1_WCF_RGT
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the Y body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the right, then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in negative Y direction (left)
param.name: BARO1_WCF_LFT
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a negative wind relative velocity along the Y body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the left, then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in positive Z direction (up)
param.name: BARO1_WCF_UP
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the Z body axis. If the baro height estimate rises above truth height during climbing flight (or forward flight with a high forwards lean angle), then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in negative Z direction (down)
param.name: BARO1_WCF_DN
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a negative wind relative velocity along the Z body axis. If the baro height estimate rises above truth height during descending flight (or forward flight with a high backwards lean angle, eg braking manoeuvre), then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.name: BARO2_WCF_ENABLE
param.documentation: This enables the use of wind coefficients for barometer compensation

param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in positive X direction (forward)
param.name: BARO2_WCF_FWD
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the X body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during forwards flight, then this will be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in negative X direction (backwards)
param.name: BARO2_WCF_BCK
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a negative wind relative velocity along the X body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during backwards flight, then this will be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in positive Y direction (right)
param.name: BARO2_WCF_RGT
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the Y body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the right, then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in negative Y direction (left)
param.name: BARO2_WCF_LFT
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a negative wind relative velocity along the Y body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the left, then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

If the baro height estimate rises above truth height during climbing flight (or forward flight with a high forwards lean angle), then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

If the baro height estimate rises above truth height during descending flight (or forward flight with a high backwards lean angle, eg braking manoeuvre), then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.name: BARO3_WCF_ENABLE
param.documentation: This enables the use of wind coefficients for barometer compensation

param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in positive X direction (forward)
param.name: BARO3_WCF_FWD
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the X body axis. param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in negative X direction (backwards)
param.name: BARO3_WCF_BCK
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a negative wind relative velocity along the X body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during backwards flight, then this will be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in positive Y direction (right)
param.name: BARO3_WCF_RGT
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the Y body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the right, then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in negative Y direction (left)
param.name: BARO3_WCF_LFT
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a negative wind relative velocity along the Y body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the left, then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in positive Z direction (up)
param.name: BARO3_WCF_UP
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the Z body axis. If the baro height estimate rises above truth height during climbing flight (or forward flight with a high forwards lean angle), then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in negative Z direction (down)
param.name: BARO3_WCF_DN
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a negative wind relative velocity along the Z body axis. If the baro height estimate rises above truth height during descending flight (or forward flight with a high backwards lean angle, eg braking manoeuvre), then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.name: BATT2_MONITOR
param.documentation: Controls enabling monitoring of the battery's voltage and current

param.name: BATT2_CAPACITY
param.documentation: Capacity of the battery in mAh when full

param.name: BATT2_SERIAL_NUM
param.documentation: Battery serial number, automatically filled in for SMBus batteries, otherwise will be -1. With DroneCan it is the battery_id.

param.name: BATT2_LOW_TIMER
param.documentation: This is the timeout in seconds before a low voltage event will be triggered. For aircraft with low C batteries it may be necessary to raise this in order to cope with low voltage on long takeoffs. A value of zero disables low voltage errors.

param.name: BATT2_FS_VOLTSRC
param.documentation: Voltage type used for detection of low voltage event

param.name: BATT2_LOW_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage that triggers a low battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT2_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT2_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT2_LOW_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity at which the low battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT2_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT2_CRT_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage that triggers a critical battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT2_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT2_FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT2_CRT_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity at which the critical battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT2_FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT2_FS_LOW_ACT
param.documentation: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a low battery failsafe

param.name: BATT2_FS_CRT_ACT
param.documentation: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a critical battery failsafe

param.name: BATT2_ARM_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage level which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any voltage.

param.name: BATT2_ARM_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity remaining which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any capacity. Note that execept for smart batteries rebooting the vehicle will always reset the remaining capacity estimate, which can lead to this check not providing sufficent protection, it is recommended to always use this in conjunction with the BATT2__ARM_VOLT parameter.

param.name: BATT2_OPTIONS
param.documentation: This sets options to change the behaviour of the battery monitor
param.field: 0:Ignore DroneCAN SoC, 1:MPPT reports input voltage and current, 2:MPPT Powered off when disarmed, 3:MPPT Powered on when armed, 4:MPPT Powered off at boot, 5:MPPT Powered on at boot, 6:Send resistance compensated voltage to GCS, 7:Allow DroneCAN InfoAux to be from a different CAN node

param.humanName: ESC Telemetry Index to write to
param.name: BATT2_ESC_INDEX
param.documentation: ESC Telemetry Index to write voltage, current, consumption and temperature data to. Use 0 to disable.

param.name: BATT2_VOLT_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for voltage monitoring.

param.name: BATT2_CURR_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for current monitoring.

param.name: BATT2_VOLT_MULT
param.documentation: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (BATT2_VOLT_PIN) to the actual battery's voltage (pin_voltage * VOLT_MULT). For the 3DR Power brick with a Pixhawk, this should be set to 10.1. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 12.02. For the PX using the PX4IO power supply this should be set to 1.

param.name: BATT2_AMP_PERVLT
param.documentation: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to. With a Pixhawk using the 3DR Power brick this should be set to 17. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 17. For Synthetic Current sensor monitors, this is the maximum, full throttle current draw.

param.name: BATT2_AMP_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor for Analog Sensors. For Synthetic Current sensor, this offset is the zero throttle system current and is added to the calculated throttle base current.

param.name: BATT2_VLT_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset on voltage pin. This allows for an offset due to a diode. This voltage is subtracted before the scaling is applied.

param.name: BATT2_I2C_BUS
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C bus number

param.name: BATT2_I2C_ADDR
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C address

param.name: BATT2_SUM_MASK
param.documentation: 0: sum of remaining battery monitors, If none 0 sum of specified monitors. Current will be summed and voltages averaged.

param.name: BATT2_CURR_MULT
param.documentation: Multiplier applied to all current related reports to allow for adjustment if no UAVCAN param access or current splitting applications

param.name: BATT2_FL_VLT_MIN
param.documentation: The voltage seen on the analog pin when the fuel tank is empty. Note: For this type of battery monitor, the voltage seen by the analog pin is displayed as battery voltage on a GCS.

param.name: BATT2_FL_V_MULT
param.documentation: Voltage multiplier to determine what the full tank voltage reading is. This is calculated as 1 / (Voltage_Full - Voltage_Empty) Note: For this type of battery monitor, the voltage seen by the analog pin is displayed as battery voltage on a GCS.

param.name: BATT2_FL_FLTR
param.documentation: Filter frequency in Hertz where a low pass filter is used. This is used to filter out tank slosh from the fuel level reading. A value of -1 disables the filter and unfiltered voltage is used to determine the fuel level. The suggested values at in the range of 0.2 Hz to 0.5 Hz.

param.name: BATT2_FL_PIN
param.documentation: Analog input pin that fuel level sensor is connected to.Analog Airspeed or RSSI ports can be used for Analog input( some autopilots provide others also). Values for some autopilots are given as examples. Search wiki for "Analog pins".

param.name: BATT2_FL_FF
param.documentation: First order polynomial fit term

param.name: BATT2_FL_FS
param.documentation: Second order polynomial fit term

param.name: BATT2_FL_FT
param.documentation: Third order polynomial fit term

param.name: BATT2_FL_OFF
param.documentation: Offset polynomial fit term

param.name: BATT2_MAX_VOLT
param.documentation: Maximum voltage of battery. Provides scaling of current versus voltage

param.name: BATT2_I2C_BUS
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C bus number

param.name: BATT2_I2C_ADDR
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C address. If this is zero then probe list of supported addresses

param.name: BATT2_MAX_AMPS
param.documentation: This controls the maximum current the INS2XX sensor will work with.

param.name: BATT2_SHUNT
param.documentation: This sets the shunt resistor used in the device

param.name: BATT2_ESC_MASK
param.documentation: If 0 all connected ESCs will be used. If non-zero, only those selected in will be used.

param.documentation: Analog input pin that fuel level sensor is connected to.Analog Airspeed or RSSI ports can be used for Analog input( some autopilots provide others also). Values for some autopilots are given as examples. Search wiki for "Analog pins".

param.name: BATT5_FL_FF
param.documentation: First order polynomial fit term

param.name: BATT5_FL_FS
param.documentation: Second order polynomial fit term

param.name: BATT5_FL_FT
param.documentation: Third order polynomial fit term

param.name: BATT5_FL_OFF
param.documentation: Offset polynomial fit term

param.name: BATT5_MAX_VOLT
param.documentation: Maximum voltage of battery. Provides scaling of current versus voltage

param.name: BATT5_I2C_BUS
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C bus number

param.name: BATT5_I2C_ADDR
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C address. If this is zero then probe list of supported addresses

param.name: BATT5_MAX_AMPS
param.documentation: This controls the maximum current the INS2XX sensor will work with.

param.name: BATT5_SHUNT
param.documentation: This sets the shunt resistor used in the device

param.name: BATT5_ESC_MASK
param.documentation: If 0 all connected ESCs will be used. If non-zero, only those selected in will be used.

param.name: BATT6_MONITOR
param.documentation: Controls enabling monitoring of the battery's voltage and current

param.name: BATT6_CAPACITY
param.documentation: Capacity of the battery in mAh when full

param.name: BATT6_SERIAL_NUM
param.documentation: Battery serial number, automatically filled in for SMBus batteries, otherwise will be -1. With DroneCan it is the battery_id.

param.name: BATT6_LOW_TIMER
param.documentation: This is the timeout in seconds before a low voltage event will be triggered. For aircraft with low C batteries it may be necessary to raise this in order to cope with low voltage on long takeoffs. A value of zero disables low voltage errors.

param.name: BATT6_FS_VOLTSRC
param.documentation: Voltage type used for detection of low voltage event

param.name: BATT6_LOW_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage that triggers a low battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT6_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT6_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT6_LOW_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity at which the low battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT6_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT6_CRT_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage that triggers a critical battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT6_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT6_FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT6_CRT_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity at which the critical battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT6_FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT6_FS_LOW_ACT
param.documentation: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a low battery failsafe

param.name: BATT6_FS_CRT_ACT
param.documentation: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a critical battery failsafe

param.name: BATT6_ARM_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage level which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any voltage.

param.name: BATT6_ARM_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity remaining which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any capacity. Note that execept for smart batteries rebooting the vehicle will always reset the remaining capacity estimate, which can lead to this check not providing sufficent protection, it is recommended to always use this in conjunction with the BATT6__ARM_VOLT parameter.

param.name: BATT6_OPTIONS
param.documentation: This sets options to change the behaviour of the battery monitor
param.field: 0:Ignore DroneCAN SoC, 1:MPPT reports input voltage and current, 2:MPPT Powered off when disarmed, 3:MPPT Powered on when armed, 4:MPPT Powered off at boot, 5:MPPT Powered on at boot, 6:Send resistance compensated voltage to GCS, 7:Allow DroneCAN InfoAux to be from a different CAN node

param.humanName: ESC Telemetry Index to write to
param.name: BATT6_ESC_INDEX
param.documentation: ESC Telemetry Index to write voltage, current, consumption and temperature data to. Use 0 to disable.

param.name: BATT6_VOLT_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for voltage monitoring.

param.name: BATT6_CURR_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for current monitoring.

param.name: BATT6_VOLT_MULT
param.documentation: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (BATT6_VOLT_PIN) to the actual battery's voltage (pin_voltage * VOLT_MULT). For the 3DR Power brick with a Pixhawk, this should be set to 10.1. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 12.02. For the PX using the PX4IO power supply this should be set to 1.

param.name: BATT6_AMP_PERVLT
param.documentation: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to. With a Pixhawk using the 3DR Power brick this should be set to 17. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 17. For Synthetic Current sensor monitors, this is the maximum, full throttle current draw.

param.name: BATT6_AMP_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor for Analog Sensors. For Synthetic Current sensor, this offset is the zero throttle system current and is added to the calculated throttle base current.

param.name: BATT6_VLT_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset on voltage pin. This allows for an offset due to a diode. This voltage is subtracted before the scaling is applied.

param.name: BATT6_I2C_BUS
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C bus number

param.name: BATT6_I2C_ADDR
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C address

param.name: BATT6_SUM_MASK
param.documentation: 0: sum of remaining battery monitors, If none 0 sum of specified monitors. Current will be summed and voltages averaged.

param.name: BATT6_CURR_MULT
param.documentation: Multiplier applied to all current related reports to allow for adjustment if no UAVCAN param access or current splitting applications

param.name: BATT6_FL_VLT_MIN
param.documentation: The voltage seen on the analog pin when the fuel tank is empty. Note: For this type of battery monitor, the voltage seen by the analog pin is displayed as battery voltage on a GCS.

param.name: BATT6_FL_V_MULT
param.documentation: Voltage multiplier to determine what the full tank voltage reading is. This is calculated as 1 / (Voltage_Full - Voltage_Empty) Note: For this type of battery monitor, the voltage seen by the analog pin is displayed as battery voltage on a GCS.

param.name: BATT6_FL_FLTR
param.documentation: Filter frequency in Hertz where a low pass filter is used. This is used to filter out tank slosh from the fuel level reading. A value of -1 disables the filter and unfiltered voltage is used to determine the fuel level. The suggested values at in the range of 0.2 Hz to 0.5 Hz.

param.name: BATT6_FL_PIN
param.documentation: Analog input pin that fuel level sensor is connected to.Analog Airspeed or RSSI ports can be used for Analog input( some autopilots provide others also). Values for some autopilots are given as examples. Search wiki for "Analog pins".

param.name: BATT6_FL_FF
param.documentation: First order polynomial fit term

param.name: BATT6_FL_FS
param.documentation: Second order polynomial fit term

param.name: BATT6_FL_FT
param.documentation: Third order polynomial fit term

param.name: BATT6_FL_OFF
param.documentation: Offset polynomial fit term

param.name: BATT6_MAX_VOLT
param.documentation: Maximum voltage of battery. Provides scaling of current versus voltage

param.name: BATT6_I2C_BUS
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C bus number

param.name: BATT6_I2C_ADDR
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C address. If this is zero then probe list of supported addresses

param.name: BATT6_MAX_AMPS
param.documentation: This controls the maximum current the INS2XX sensor will work with.

param.name: BATT6_SHUNT
param.documentation: This sets the shunt resistor used in the device

param.name: BATT6_ESC_MASK
param.documentation: If 0 all connected ESCs will be used. If non-zero, only those selected in will be used.
